Hi.. I am unable to deploy/invoke/query chaincodes with the latest code.. Here are the steps I followed..
1) cloned latest code
2) make peer
3) peer node start --peer-chaincodedev
4) CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=0.0.0.0:7051 chaincode_example02
5) peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -c '{"Args": ["init", "a", "100", "b", "200"]}'
I am getting the following error: [chaincode] Launch -> ERRO 017 sending init failed(handler not found for chaincode mycc)
anyone able to deploy chaincode example with the latest code?

initial_comment.comment: For the command `make peer`, do I have to start up docker too as well? I ran `vagrant up` and let it do it's thing and build and everything. Then when I sshed into my vagrant, I tried to run `make peer` and it gave me this error

text: Error: Non-empty JSON chaincode parameters must contain exactly 1 key: 'Args'.   I got this error when I run peer chain code deploy follow the instruction, could anyone help?
I have figure out the problem... just change the command to => peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -c '{"Args": ["init", "a", "100", "b", "200"]}'
it seems the code in this guide <http://cbf-fabric-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Chaincode-setup/#chaincode-deploy-via-cli-and-rest> is wrong
where can I get the latest guide? or the latest CLI API?
<@U20T0R475>: although i dont use vagrant, but according to your error message it seems you need to have docker daemon started...

<@U0YQK8WSV>:  i think mycc should be the path to the chaincode you want to deploy, ie : <http://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/example/chaincode/go/chaincode_example02/|github.com/hyperledger/fabric/example/chaincode/go/chaincode_example02/>

did something happen? :slightly_smiling_face:
